description: In this Popular Recipe, Chef Elana makes the “grandma pie” technique super easy to recreate at home. If you haven’t tried this crispy, saucy specialty, this is your moment. Similar to the kind of pizza you'd enjoy in an Italian nonna's home, it features a thin, crispy crust topped with plenty of cheese, crushed tomato, chopped garlic, and olive oil, baked in a sheet pan or skillet until golden and gooey. We're smothering ours with mozzarella, provolone, and Parmesan, because you can never have too much cheese.
name: Skillet Grandma Pie with Parmesan-Kale Salad
subtitle: with Parmesan-Kale Salad
title: Skillet Grandma Pie
cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Pizza dough softens as it warms—the longer you let it sit at room temperature, the easier it’ll be to roll out. We recommend at least 15 minutes, so that once the salad is finished, your dough is good to go.


Want to see our technique for making garlic paste? Head to plated.me/chopshop for a how-to video straight from our Test Kitchen.


If you prefer a cheesier pizza, feel free to sprinkle all of the remaining Parmesan cheese over just the pizza, and not the salad.
ingredients: shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese blend

ingredients_full.name: shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese blend

steps.title: Simmer tomato sauce
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450ºF. Remove pizza dough from bag and let soften at room temperature (see recipe tip). In a medium ovenproof pan, heat crushed tomatoes over high heat (we love using cast iron, but any ovenproof pan will do the trick). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook until thickened, 10-12 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper as desired. Transfer tomato sauce to a bowl and wipe pan clean for Step 4.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: While sauce simmers, rinse kale and pat dry with paper towel, then thinly slice leaves, discarding stems. Using your hands, massage kale until beginning to soften, 1-2 minutes. Halve lemon. Mince garlic and, still on cutting board, sprinkle over .125 teaspoon salt. Using a large knife, carefully scrape over mixture at a 45° angle, pressing down. Repeat until garlic is broken down and a paste forms (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Make Parmesan-kale salad
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk together mustard, juice of 1 lemon, garlic paste, 2 tablespoons olive oil, .125 teaspoon salt, and black pepper as desired. Gently stir in half of Parmesan, then add kale and toss to coat. Set aside to marinate until ready to serve.

steps.title: Prepare dough
steps.description: Using your hands, stretch and shape dough into a circle about the same size as your ovenproof pan. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in pan from sauce over medium heat. Working very carefully, add dough, stretching to fill pan. Increase heat to medium high. Cook, without flipping, until bubbles form on top and bottom is golden, about 5 minutes. Remove pan from heat.

steps.title: Assemble grandma pie
steps.description: Brush 1 teaspoon olive oil over dough in pan, being sure to coat edges, and season with .25 teaspoon salt and black pepper as desired. Sprinkle over mozzarella and provolone, then dollop over tomato sauce (the reverse layering of cheese, then sauce is what makes this pie so special!). Sprinkle over crushed red pepper (skip or use half for less heat).

steps.title: Bake grandma pie and plate
steps.description: Transfer grandma pie to oven and bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted, about 20 minutes (this is a great time to relax with a glass of wine). Let cool for about 5 minutes, then transfer to a cutting board and cut into slices. Serve with Parmesan-kale salad. Sprinkle over remaining Parmesan (see recipe tip) and dig in!
